verses.verse: ( David’s Messengers Disgraced) ( 130 19:1-9 ) וַֽיְהִי֙ <WH1961> way·hî - אַֽחֲרֵי־ <WH310> ’a·ḥă·rê- Some time later, כֵ֔ן <WH3651> ḵên ... וַיָּ֕מָת <WH4191> way·yā·māṯ died מֶ֖לֶךְ <WH4428> me·leḵ the king בְּנֵ֣י <WH1121> bə·nê of the Ammonites עַמּ֑וֹן <WH5983> ‘am·mō·wn ... וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ <WH4427> way·yim·lōḵ and was succeeded by חָנ֥וּן <WH2586> ḥā·nūn Hanun. בְּנ֖וֹ <WH1121> bə·nōw his son תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ <WH8478> taḥ·tāw -

וַיֹּ֨אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer said, דָּוִ֜ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ And David אֶעֱשֶׂה־ <WH6213> ’e·‘ĕ·śeh- “ I will show חֶ֣סֶד׀ <WH2617> ḥe·seḏ kindness עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- to חָנ֣וּן <WH2586> ḥā·nūn Hanun בֶּן־ <WH1121> ben- son נָחָ֗שׁ <WH5176> nā·ḥāš of Nahash, כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ <WH834> ka·’ă·šer just as עָשָׂ֨ה <WH6213> ‘ā·śāh showed אָבִ֤יו <WH1> ’ā·ḇîw his father עִמָּדִי֙ <WH5978> ‘im·mā·ḏî to me. ” חֶ֔סֶד <WH2617> ḥe·seḏ kindness וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח <WH7971> way·yiš·laḥ sent דָּוִ֧ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ So David לְנַחֲמ֛וֹ <WH5162> lə·na·ḥă·mōw to console [Hanun] בְּיַד־ <WH3027> bə·yaḏ- ... עֲבָדָ֖יו <WH5650> ‘ă·ḇā·ḏāw some of his servants אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- concerning אָבִ֑יו <WH1> ’ā·ḇîw his father. וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ <WH935> way·yā·ḇō·’ū arrived עַבְדֵ֣י <WH5650> ‘aḇ·ḏê But when they דָוִ֔ד <WH1732> ḏā·wiḏ ... אֶ֖רֶץ <WH776> ’e·reṣ in the land בְּנֵ֥י <WH1121> bə·nê of the Ammonites עַמּֽוֹן׃ <WH5983> ‘am·mō·wn ...,

וַיֹּאמְרוּ֩ <WH559> way·yō·mə·rū said שָׂרֵ֨י <WH8269> śā·rê the princes בְנֵֽי־ <WH1121> ḇə·nê- of the Ammonites עַמּ֜וֹן <WH5983> ‘am·mō·wn ... אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to חָנ֣וּן <WH2586> ḥā·nūn Hanun אֲדֹֽנֵיהֶ֗ם <WH113> ’ă·ḏō·nê·hem their lord, הַֽמְכַבֵּ֨ד <WH3513> ham·ḵab·bêḏ showing respect דָּוִ֤ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ he is אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - אָבִ֙יךָ֙ <WH1> ’ā·ḇî·ḵā for your father? בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ <WH5869> bə·‘ê·ne·ḵā do you really believe כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- “ Just because שָׁלַ֥ח <WH7971> šā·laḥ David has sent לְךָ֖ Prep│2ms ( lə·ḵā) you מְנַֽחֲמִ֑ים 5162 V-Piel-Prtcpl-mp ( mə·na·ḥă·mîm) comforters, הֲ֠לוֹא 3808 Adv-NegPrt ( hă·lō·w) Has not בַּעֲב֞וּר 5668 Prep-b│N-ms ( ba·‘ă·ḇūr) - חֲק֤וֹר 2713 V-Qal-Inf ( ḥă·qō·wr) to explore אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - הָעִיר֙ 5892 Art│N-fs ( hā·‘îr) the city, וּלְרַגְּלָ֣הּ 7270 Conj-w, Prep-l│V-Piel-Inf│3fs ( ū·lə·rag·gə·lāh) spy it out, וּלְהָפְכָ֔הּ 2015 Conj-w, Prep-l│V-Qal-Inf│3fs ( ū·lə·hā·p̄ə·ḵāh) and overthrow it? ” שָׁלַ֥ח 7971 V-Qal-Perf-3ms ( šā·laḥ) [instead] sent דָּוִ֛ד 1732 N-proper-ms ( dā·wiḏ) David אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - עֲבָדָ֖יו 5650 N-mpc│3ms ( ‘ă·ḇā·ḏāw) his servants אֵלֶֽיךָ׃ 413 Prep│2ms ( ’ê·le·ḵā) ...

וַיִּקַּ֨ח <WH3947> way·yiq·qaḥ took חָנ֜וּן <WH2586> ḥā·nūn So Hanun אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - עַבְדֵ֣י <WH5650> ‘aḇ·ḏê servants, דָוִ֗ד <WH1732> ḏā·wiḏ David’s וַיְגַלַּח֙ <WH1548> way·ḡal·laḥ shaved off אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - חֲצִ֣י <WH2677> ḥă·ṣî half זְקָנָ֔ם <WH2206> zə·qā·nām of each man’s beard, וַיִּכְרֹ֧ת <WH3772> way·yiḵ·rōṯ cut off אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - מַדְוֵיהֶ֛ם <WH4063> maḏ·wê·hem their garments בַּחֵ֖צִי <WH2677> ba·ḥê·ṣî vvv עַ֣ד <WH5704> ‘aḏ at שְׁתֽוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם <WH8357> šə·ṯō·w·ṯê·hem the hips, וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵֽם׃ <WH7971> way·šal·lə·ḥêm and sent them away.

וַיַּגִּ֤דוּ <WH5046> way·yag·gi·ḏū When this was reported לְדָוִד֙ <WH1732> lə·ḏā·wiḏ to David, וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח <WH7971> way·yiš·laḥ he sent messengers לִקְרָאתָ֔ם <WH7122> liq·rā·ṯām to meet [the men], כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- since הָי֥וּ <WH1961> hā·yū they had been הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים <WH582> hā·’ă·nā·šîm ... נִכְלָמִ֣ים <WH3637> niḵ·lā·mîm humiliated. מְאֹ֑ד <WH3966> mə·’ōḏ thoroughly וַיֹּ֤אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer told them, הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ <WH4428> ham·me·leḵ The king שְׁב֣וּ <WH3427> šə·ḇū “ Stay בִֽירֵח֔וֹ <WH3405> ḇî·rê·ḥōw in Jericho עַד־ <WH5704> ‘aḏ- until יְצַמַּ֥ח <WH6779> yə·ṣam·maḥ have grown back, זְקַנְכֶ֖ם <WH2206> zə·qan·ḵem your beards וְשַׁבְתֶּֽם׃ <WH7725> wə·šaḇ·tem and [then] return. ”

וַיִּרְאוּ֙ <WH7200> way·yir·’ū realized that בְּנֵ֣י <WH1121> bə·nê When the Ammonites עַמּ֔וֹן <WH5983> ‘am·mō·wn ... כִּ֥י <WH3588> kî ... נִבְאֲשׁ֖וּ <WH887> niḇ·’ă·šū they had become a stench בְּדָוִ֑ד <WH1732> bə·ḏā·wiḏ to David, וַיִּשְׁלְח֣וּ <WH7971> way·yiš·lə·ḥū ... בְנֵֽי־ <WH1121> ḇə·nê- they עַמּ֡וֹן <WH5983> ‘am·mō·wn ... וַיִּשְׂכְּרוּ֩ <WH7936> way·yiś·kə·rū hired אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - אֲרַ֨ם <WH758> ’ă·ram Aramean בֵּית־ <WH1050> bêṯ- vvv רְח֜וֹב <WH1050> rə·ḥō·wḇ from Beth-rehob וְאֶת־ <WH853> wə·’eṯ- and אֲרַ֣ם <WH758> ’ă·ram - צוֹבָ֗א <WH6678> ṣō·w·ḇā Zoba, עֶשְׂרִ֥ים <WH6242> ‘eś·rîm twenty אֶ֙לֶף֙ <WH505> ’e·lep̄ thousand רַגְלִ֔י <WH7273> raḡ·lî foot soldiers וְאֶת־ <WH853> wə·’eṯ- as well as מֶ֤לֶךְ <WH4428> me·leḵ from the king מַֽעֲכָה֙ <WH4601> ma·‘ă·ḵāh of Maacah אֶ֣לֶף <WH505> ’e·lep̄ a thousand אִ֔ישׁ <WH376> ’îš men וְאִ֣ישׁ <WH376> wə·’îš men ט֔וֹב <WH2897> ṭō·wḇ from Tob. שְׁנֵים־ <WH8147> šə·nêm- and twelve עָשָׂ֥ר <WH6240> ‘ā·śār ... אֶ֖לֶף <WH505> ’e·lep̄ ... אִֽישׁ׃ <WH376> ’îš thousand

וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע <WH8085> way·yiš·ma‘ On hearing this, דָּוִ֑ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ David וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ <WH7971> way·yiš·laḥ sent אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - יוֹאָ֔ב <WH3097> yō·w·’āḇ Joab וְאֵ֥ת <WH853> wə·’êṯ and כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- the entire הַצָּבָ֖א <WH6635> haṣ·ṣā·ḇā army הַגִּבֹּרִֽים׃ <WH1368> hag·gib·bō·rîm of mighty men.

וַיֵּֽצְאוּ֙ <WH3318> way·yê·ṣə·’ū marched out בְּנֵ֣י <WH1121> bə·nê The Ammonites עַמּ֔וֹן <WH5983> ‘am·mō·wn ... וַיַּעַרְכ֥וּ <WH6186> way·ya·‘ar·ḵū and arrayed themselves מִלְחָמָ֖ה <WH4421> mil·ḥā·māh for battle פֶּ֣תַח <WH6607> pe·ṯaḥ at the entrance הַשָּׁ֑עַר <WH8179> haš·šā·‘ar of the city gate, וַאֲרַ֨ם <WH758> wa·’ă·ram while the Arameans צוֹבָ֤א <WH6678> ṣō·w·ḇā of Zobah וּרְחוֹב֙ <WH7340> ū·rə·ḥō·wḇ and Rehob וְאִֽישׁ־ <WH376> wə·’îš- and the men ט֣וֹב <WH2897> ṭō·wḇ of Tob וּמַֽעֲכָ֔ה <WH4601> ū·ma·‘ă·ḵāh and Maacah לְבַדָּ֖ם <WH905> lə·ḇad·dām were by themselves בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃ <WH7704> baś·śā·ḏeh in the open country.

וַיַּ֣רְא <WH7200> way·yar saw ( David Defeats Ammon and Aram) ( 130 19:10-19) יוֹאָ֗ב 3097 N-proper-ms ( yō·w·’āḇ) When Joab כִּֽי־ 3588 Conj ( kî-) vvv הָיְתָ֤ה 1961 V-Qal-Perf-3fs ( hā·yə·ṯāh) vvv אֵלָיו֙ 413 Prep│3ms ( ’ê·lāw) vvv פְּנֵ֣י 6440 N-cpc ( pə·nê) - הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה 4421 Art│N-fs ( ham·mil·ḥā·māh) the battle lines מִפָּנִ֖ים 6440 Prep-m│N-mp ( mip·pā·nîm) before him וּמֵֽאָח֑וֹר 268 Conj-w, Prep-m│N-ms ( ū·mê·’ā·ḥō·wr) and behind him, וַיִּבְחַ֗ר 977 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3ms ( way·yiḇ·ḥar) he selected מִכֹּל֙ 3605 Prep-m│N-msc ( mik·kōl) some of בְּחוּרֵ֣י 977 V-Qal-QalPassPrtcpl-mpc ( bə·ḥū·rê) the best בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל 3478 N-proper-ms ( bə·yiś·rå̄·ʾēl) men of Israel וַֽיַּעֲרֹ֖ךְ 6186 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3ms ( way·ya·‘ă·rōḵ) and arrayed them לִקְרַ֥את 7122 Prep-l│V-Qal-Inf ( liq·raṯ) against אֲרָֽם׃ 758 N-proper-fs ( ’ă·rām) the Arameans.

וְאֵת֙ <WH853> wə·’êṯ And יֶ֣תֶר <WH3499> ye·ṯer the rest הָעָ֔ם <WH5971> hā·‘ām of the forces נָתַ֕ן <WH5414> nā·ṯan he placed בְּיַ֖ד <WH3027> bə·yaḏ under the command אַבְשַׁ֣י <WH52> ’aḇ·šay Abishai, אָחִ֑יו <WH251> ’ā·ḥîw of his brother וַֽיַּעֲרֹ֕ךְ <WH6186> way·ya·‘ă·rōḵ who arrayed them לִקְרַ֖את <WH7122> liq·raṯ against בְּנֵ֥י <WH1121> bə·nê the Ammonites עַמּֽוֹן׃ <WH5983> ‘am·mō·wn ....

וַיֹּ֗אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer said Joab, אִם־ <WH518> ’im- “ If תֶּחֱזַ֤ק <WH2388> te·ḥĕ·zaq are too strong אֲרָם֙ <WH758> ’ă·rām the Arameans מִמֶּ֔נִּי <WH4480> mim·men·nî for me, ” וְהָיִ֥תָה <WH1961> wə·hā·yi·ṯāh “ then you will come לִּ֖י Prep│1cs ( lî) .... לִֽישׁוּעָ֑ה 3444 Prep-l│N-fs ( lî·šū·‘āh) to my rescue וְאִם־ 518 Conj ( wə·’im-) And if בְּנֵ֤י 1121 N-mpc ( bə·nê) the Ammonites עַמּוֹן֙ 5983 N-proper-ms ( ‘am·mō·wn) ... יֶחֱזְק֣וּ 2388 V-Qal-Imperf-3mp ( ye·ḥĕz·qū) are too strong מִמְּךָ֔ 4480 Prep│2ms ( mim·mə·ḵā) for you, וְהָלַכְתִּ֖י 1980 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConjPerf-1cs ( wə·hā·laḵ·tî) then I will come לְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַֽ 3467 Prep-l│V-Hifil-Inf ( lə·hō·wō·šî·a‘) to your rescue לָֽךְ׃ Prep│2fs ( lāḵ) ....

חֲזַ֤ק <WH2388> ḥă·zaq Be strong וְנִתְחַזַּק֙ <WH2388> wə·niṯ·ḥaz·zaq and let us fight bravely בְּעַד־ <WH1157> bə·‘aḏ- for עַמֵּ֔נוּ <WH5971> ‘am·mê·nū our people וּבְעַ֖ד <WH1157> ū·ḇə·‘aḏ and for עָרֵ֣י <WH5892> ‘ā·rê the cities אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hê·nū of our God. וַֽיהוָ֔ה <WH3068> Yah·weh May the LORD יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה <WH6213> ya·‘ă·śeh do הַטּ֖וֹב <WH2896> haṭ·ṭō·wḇ what is good בְּעֵינָֽיו׃ <WH5869> bə·‘ê·nāw in His sight. ”

וַיִּגַּ֣שׁ <WH5066> way·yig·gaš advanced יוֹאָ֗ב <WH3097> yō·w·’āḇ So Joab וְהָעָם֙ <WH5971> wə·hā·‘ām and his troops אֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> ’ă·šer - עִמּ֔וֹ <WH5973> ‘im·mōw - לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה <WH4421> lam·mil·ḥā·māh to fight בַּֽאֲרָ֑ם <WH758> ba·’ă·rām the Arameans, וַיָּנֻ֖סוּ <WH5127> way·yā·nu·sū who fled מִפָּנָֽיו׃ <WH6440> mip·pā·nāw before him.

וּבְנֵ֨י <WH1121> ū·ḇə·nê When the Ammonites עַמּ֤וֹן <WH5983> ‘am·mō·wn ... רָאוּ֙ <WH7200> rā·’ū saw כִּי־ <WH3588> kî- that נָ֣ס <WH5127> nās had fled, אֲרָ֔ם <WH758> ’ă·rām the Arameans וַיָּנֻ֙סוּ֙ <WH5127> way·yā·nu·sū they too fled מִפְּנֵ֣י <WH6440> mip·pə·nê before אֲבִישַׁ֔י <WH52> ’ă·ḇî·šay Abishai, וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ <WH935> way·yā·ḇō·’ū and they entered הָעִ֑יר <WH5892> hā·‘îr the city. וַיָּ֣שָׁב <WH7725> way·yā·šāḇ returned יוֹאָ֗ב <WH3097> yō·w·’āḇ So Joab מֵעַל֙ <WH5921> mê·‘al from [fighting] against בְּנֵ֣י <WH1121> bə·nê the Ammonites עַמּ֔וֹן <WH5983> ‘am·mō·wn ... וַיָּבֹ֖א <WH935> way·yā·ḇō and came יְרוּשָׁלִָֽם׃ <WH3389> yə·rū·šā·lim to Jerusalem.

וַיַּ֣רְא <WH7200> way·yar saw אֲרָ֔ם <WH758> ’ă·rām When the Arameans כִּ֥י <WH3588> kî that נִגַּ֖ף <WH5062> nig·gap̄ they had been defeated לִפְנֵ֣י <WH6440> lip̄·nê by יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl Israel, וַיֵּאָסְפ֖וּ <WH622> way·yê·’ā·sə·p̄ū they regrouped יָֽחַד׃ <WH3162> yā·ḥaḏ ....

וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח <WH7971> way·yiš·laḥ sent הֲדַדְעֶ֗זֶר <WH1909> hă·ḏaḏ·‘e·zer Hadadezer וַיֹּצֵ֤א <WH3318> way·yō·ṣê messengers to bring אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - אֲרָם֙ <WH758> ’ă·rām [more] Arameans אֲשֶׁר֙ <WH834> ’ă·šer - מֵעֵ֣בֶר <WH5676> mê·‘ê·ḇer from beyond הַנָּהָ֔ר <WH5104> han·nā·hār the Euphrates, ( Hebrew the River) וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ <WH935> way·yā·ḇō·’ū and they came חֵילָ֑ם <WH2431> ḥê·lām to Helam וְשׁוֹבַ֛ךְ <WH7731> wə·šō·w·ḇaḵ with Shobach ( Shobach is a variant of Shophach; see .) שַׂר־ <WH8269> śar- the commander צְבָ֥א <WH6635> ṣə·ḇā army הֲדַדְעֶ֖זֶר <WH1909> hă·ḏaḏ·‘e·zer of Hadadezer’s לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃ <WH6440> lip̄·nê·hem leading them.
